TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national born in DATE and living in GPE .

The applicant was a member of ORG until DATE . DATE until DATE he was a member of ORG . He has not been a member of a political party since DATE . In DATE , on the proposal of a NORP member of ORG , the applicant was appointed Senior Advisor to ORG .
On DATE ORG nominated the applicant for the post of Director of ORG ( ORG ) , an intergovernmental organisation .

On DATE by a decision of ORG the ORG countries the applicant was appointed Director of the ORG as of DATE . The applicant has not submitted further details such as whether an employment contract was signed , or not .
In DATE there was a change of Government in GPE .
In DATE the applicant attended a meeting of a drafting group of the ORG in GPE . In TIME he was referred to as Director - elect , appointed as of DATE .

On DATE ORG accepted the proposal of the Minister of ORG to “ withdraw ” the applicant ’s nomination on the ground that “ the nomination of Mr PERSON , approved by ORG , [ was ] not in conformity with the tasks of the new Government ” .
ORG nominated another person for the post of Director of the ORG Permanent ORG . On DATE that person was appointed to the post of Director by a decision of ORG the ORG countries .
On an unspecified date the applicant lodged an appeal with ORG against the ORG of ORG decision of DATE . The court held a hearing . On DATE the applicant ’s appeal was declared inadmissible .

The court held that the impugned Government decision did not constitute an administrative act within the meaning of LAW and that , therefore , it was not subject to a judicial appeal . ORG had exercised their power set out in LAW to conduct GPE ’s foreign policy . The applicant ’s appeal concerned solely the withdrawal of the mandate given to him by ORG to represent the country in the ORG , which did not entail any administrative or civil consequences for him .
LAW CARDINAL of the LAW provides that a judicial appeal lies against any administrative decision except expressly excluded by law .

ORG ( ORG ) is an intergovernmental organisation founded by the following participating GPE : GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE , GPE and GPE . It was created on DATE and has its headquarters in GPE , GPE .

The applicant has not provided detailed information on the organisation ’s structure and governing bodies at the relevant time ( its LAW came into force only on CARDINAL May CARDINAL , after the period under consideration in the present case ) .

The applicant submitted excerpts from the “ Regulations for the Staff of the Permanent International Secretariat of the ORG ” , apparently in force at the relevant time . Under the ORG the Director was appointed by ORG the ORG participating GPE among the nominees proposed by those ORG . All nominations , accompanied by the candidates’ CV / resumes and other relevant information , had to be notified to the participating LAW . The Director was appointed in accordance with the rule of rotation . “ Geographical distribution and equitable representation [ were ] also taken into account . ”
The duties of the Director were , inter alia , to represent the ORG in the host country and to supervise the management and the fiscal resources of the ORG .
